• Preferably having previous design experiences in one or more of the following areas: high-speed laser, electro absorption modulated laser (EML), vertical cavity surface- emitting laser (VCSEL), and high-power laser.
• Laser testing and characterization experience is a plusFully understand theories of semiconductor laser, photodetectors, and other optoelectronic devices.
• Significant experience in semiconductor technology development role with laser design is preferred.
• Proven experience working with manufacturing partners such as suppliers, OSATs and foundry partners.
• Knowledge of basic semiconductor device fabrication process is a plusExperience in a leadership role driving cross-functional teams Prior experience driving high power laser development, design, thermal managementExperience working with laser device vendors as well as pluggable module assembly vendorsAnalyze experimental results to improve the design or model.
• Device experience in DFB lasers, III-V semiconductorsIn-depth knowledge of laser module fabricationWork as a team to propose new laser designs and provide support to design optimizations.
• BS/MS/PhD in Material Science, Mechanical Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Electrical Engineering, or equivalent.
• AMD Partner Hub Authorized Distributors AMD University Program Investor Relations Financial Information Board of Directors Governance Documents SEC Filings.

• Working knowledge of 3DIC advanced packaging technologies including CoWoS and SoICPast experience of supporting FPGA product silicon development and NPI is required Strong background in development and tapeout of process and IP validation test vehicles Working knowledge of IP and SoC analog and digital design flows with foundry PDK support experience Experience with major EDA tools for device model, layout, circuit simulation, parasitic extraction, and physical verificationFamiliarity with device reliability degradation mechanisms, test methods, and lifetime modelingStrong analytical, problem solving, decision-making and communication skillsPrior team leadership and management experience is a plus Responsible for technology definition, PPAC assessment and design-technology co-optimization (DTCO) for FPGA and ASIC products in advanced nodes (3nm, 2nm & beyond)Work with design and technology to accomplish robust IP & product designsWork with CAD & PDK teams to enable design environment and support PDK needs in advanced nodes with 3DIC technologyCoordinate testchip design and tapeout for process and IP validation prior to NPI phaseResponsible for product WAT analysis, performance correlation and yield analysis during NPI in collaboration with foundry and design teamsAssist FPGA and ASIC technology roadmap exploration to meet end customer requirements Bachelor degree in engineering or physical science, with advanced degree (MS or PhD) strongly preferred AMD Partner Hub Authorized Distributors AMD University Program Investor Relations Financial Information Board of Directors Governance Documents SEC Filings.
• Familiar with advanced semiconductor technologies and industry roadmap including FinFET, GAA, Backside Power etc.
